channel.title: [PI] Different EXP/XP Modes
channel.description:
Hello there, I have been working really hard on my InsidiaX source trying to get it complete.
I suddenly just had the idea to add different exp/xp modes... I believe it gives the people the choice to choose what they would like exactly... Some like it hard and some like it easy.. Anyways, I am looking to add Easy-Mode, Medium, Hard & Extreme.... Different drop rates as well as different exp/xp rates ofc .. I came upon this tutorial, i'm not sure if this should be the one to use. However, I still wanted to get your guys opinion on this... I also wanted to see if anyone else could help me do this in a more shorter/efficient way. Any and every help is greatly appreciated. TUT LINK: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=545304.0

item.title: [PI] Different EXP/XP Modes
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“haviland4, post:13, topic:551449”]your not following the guide because i updated the one you quoted

"easyMode = false,mediumMode = false,hardMode = false,extremeMode =

The Updated one you quoted that i redone only had the following…

Please could you follow the guide that you quoted because that’s the updated verison

if (easyMode || mediumMode || hardMode || ExtremeMode)[/quote]
You clearly don’t understand what he is saying.

Since you have 4 booleans deciding which game mode the player is in… What if all booleans were set to true?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Different EXP/XP Modes
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“haviland4, post:3, topic:551449”]The tutorial will give you a couple of errors for example

When logging out and in the character will null here i have fixed the problem but i still wouldn’t suggest you adding the walking.java

playersave.java
Under this:

Add:

} else if (token.equals("finishTut")) { p.finishedTut = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2);

Now find:

add this in this area:

            characterfile.write("finishTut = ", 0, 12);
            characterfile.write(Boolean.toString(p.finishedTut), 0, Boolean.toString(p.finishedTut).length());
            characterfile.newLine();[/code]

player.java

Above this

[code]public boolean
	initialized = false,[/code]

add this

[code]
public static boolean	
	easyMode = false,
	mediumMode = false,
	hardMode = false,
	extremeMode = false,
	finishedTut = false;
[/code]


client.java

Find:
[code]                        getPA().handleWeaponStyle();

Add this above it:

if (!finishedTut) { getDH().sendDialogues(850, -1); }

Find this

Add under:

dialoguehandler.java

Add this

case 850: sendOption4("Easy Mode 5000 xp rate", "Medium Mode 500 xp rate", "Hard Mode 50 xp rate", "Extreme Mode 10 xp rate"); c.dialogueAction = 850; break;

In Config.java change this

public static final int MELEE_EXP_RATE = 1400; // damage * exp rate
	public static final int RANGE_EXP_RATE = 1600;
	public static final int MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 1600;

to this

public static int MELEE_EXP_RATE;
	public static int RANGE_EXP_RATE;
	public static int MAGIC_EXP_RATE;

clickingbuttons.java

Find these:

Add under:

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 5000; Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 5000; Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 5000; c.easyMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); }

Find:

Add Under:

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 500; Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 500; Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 500; c.mediumMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); }

Find:

Add Under:

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 50; Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 50; Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 50; c.hardMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); }

Find:

Under add:

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 10; Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 10; Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 10; c.extremeMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); }

combatassistant.java

Find Somthing Like this

Add this Above:

public static int meleeExp() {
        if (Player.easyMode) {
		} else if (Player.mediumMode) {
		} else if (Player.hardMode) {
		} else if (Player.extremeMode) {
		}
		return Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE; 
		}
	public static int rangeExp() {
        if (Player.easyMode) {
		} else if (Player.mediumMode) {
		} else if (Player.hardMode) {
		} else if (Player.extremeMode) {
		}
		return Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE;
		}
	public static int magicExp() {
        if (Player.easyMode) {
		} else if (Player.mediumMode) {
		} else if (Player.hardMode) {
		} else if (Player.extremeMode) {
		}
		return Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE;
		}

The other combatassistant.java

Find:

if(c.prayerActive[25]) { strength += (int)(lvlForXP * .23); }
Add Under:

if (c.easyMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .03); } else if (c.mediumMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .06); } else if (c.hardMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .09); } else if (c.extremeMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .12); }

^ this will get a slight max hit boost for the differnt modes

walking.java

Add:

if (!c.finishedTut) { c.sendMessage("You must first select a difficulty mode."); return; }

Than in Client.java find this

under PlayerSave.saveGame(this);

add Player.finishedTut = false;[/quote]

For the part “easyMode = false,mediumMode = false,hardMode = false,extremeMode = false,finishedTut = false;” I get identifer expected error, why is this happening?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Different EXP/XP Modes
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Yeah. It’s called using an Enum or a single integer.

Why the hell would you use 10 booleans for game modes?

public enum GameMode { EASY, MEDIUM, HARD, EXTREME; }

Then to save it you would just have to use the “toString” method. And for loading (Since you probably have the text file saving) you will probably need to make a for loop in the player loading, and then see of the text value of the saved Enum is equal to the toString value of the item in the Enum.

Alternatively, you can use an integer:

[code=java]
private int gameMode = -1;

public String getGameMode() {
switch(gameMode) {
case 0:
return “Easy”;
}
}[/code]
And I’d hope you know how to save that.

The whole part about the “finishedTut” boolean can easily be avoided.

  1. check if the saved enum value is null.
  2. check if the integer value is -1.
    If 1 or two is true (depending on your method), then send the dialogues. If not, don’t.

That should give you a good start…

Read full topic
